iti8:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti8:2.1_0: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding conceit, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
iti8:2.2_0: By directly knowing and completely understanding conceit, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”
iti8:3.1_0: “These folk are caught up in conceit,
iti8:3.2_0: tied by conceit, delighting in existence.
iti8:4.1_0: Those who have given up conceit,
iti8:4.2_0: freed in the ending of conceit,
iti8:4.3_0: vanquishers of the tie of conceit,
iti8:5.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
